column4: Hi! I need to expand the partition where I have Ubuntu. Can I do this with a Live USB?
Do you have a seperate /home partition?
No, I have everything on one partition atm.
I guess just moving the homefolder to a seperate partition would serve the same purpose. How do I do that?
Wouldn't it be a solution to create a new big /home partition (maybe seperate hd) and moove all your personal data to that /home partition, as this is probably the biggest folder ;)
1. create a new partition with gparted --> format ext4, mpuntpoint /home .... ;)
Ah, much simpler than the guides I found. thx
There could be some problems with user names... Could be that your user folder changes rights to 'user 1000 or so, depending the order your user were added... first user --> 1000'
Ok ... I'll give it a go :)
Hm, to move the home folder, do I first copy the folder to the new partition, then change fstab, then reboot?
I would do exactly that ... You may even copy the files and then change the fstab on the harddisk via a live CD.
Yeah, ok ... I'm doing it via my regular install now, first moving the files, then changing fstab. Should that work?
In that case I would change your fstab via recovery mode left <shift> before grub stats, using nano.
Hm, I got it working now ... But do you know where my old home folder is now? Somewhere under / ?
